column4: Can someone who is running Ubuntu 11.10 and Server version: Apache/2.2.20 (Ubuntu) pastebin the output of the /etc/apache2/httpd.conf for me? I seem to have deleted the contents of mine and apache is failing to start with the contents of the Ubuntu one https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/oneiric/+source/apache2/2.2.20-1ubuntu1.2
It is just a local development environment for Drupal and other sites
I need to get virtual hosts working and I think I need some data in the httpd.conf file
you should be able to reinstall the package
k, I can try that. is it apt-get reinstall apache2
Thanks, I ran it and it went great, but the httpd.conf file was not updated so based on what Praxi said I think it ships empty
it definately ships with content. Does the file exist - but it's empty? if so, remove it. Buit you should now have a httpd.conf.dist which you can copy in its place
Yeah, it exists but is empty, i will remove it
check there isn't a .dist version next to it now. If not, delete it and reinstall.
There wasn't a dist version, I deleted it, reinstalled and it did not put the file back
What does yours say, if you have one?
let me see if I have an install - 11.04?
Nevermind, httpd.conf is deprecated, apache2.conf is where it is at now a ways - http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=5680993#post5680993
and praxi - thanks for your help
and praxi - It appears httpd.conf isn't actually deprecated but just for user configurations - http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2567432/ubuntu-apache-httpd-conf-or-apache2-conf
